meanings.definition: To set or establish boundaries or limits.
meanings.sent1: The fence demarcates the edge of the property.
meanings.sent2: The demarcation line clearly shows where the garden ends.
meanings.sent3: The ruler demarcates the space for each student's drawing.
meanings.sent4: The demarcating tape separates the two sections of the field.
meanings.sent5: The sign demarcates the entrance to the park with a bold arrow.

meanings.sent1: The color red demarcates the danger zones on the map.
meanings.sent2: The demarcating factor between the twins is their birthmarks.
meanings.sent3: The unique smell of the bakery demarcates it from other shops.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice demarcates him as the leader of the group.
meanings.sent5: The special badge demarcates the VIP guests from the rest of the crowd.
